sentences.english: Speak your mind… even if your voice shakes.
sentences.chinese: 果敢说出你的想法，哪怕声响会惊怖。

sentences.english: You need to be alert, keep calm, think clearly, act decisively.
sentences.chinese: 你必须时刻警惕，头脑冷静，思维清晰，行动果敢。

sentences.english: Is dignity nobility, resolute and courageous pursue dream.
Would you strokes be tremblingly timid or brilliantly bold?
sentences.chinese: 你落笔时会颤抖胆怯，还是敏锐果敢？

sentences.english: Chinese media say as many as 10, 000 Chinese citizens do business in Kokang.
sentences.chinese: 中国媒体报道有1万多名中国人在果敢做生意。

sentences.english: Courtesy and serenity of temper I first learnt to know from my grandfather Verus.
sentences.chinese: 从我父亲的名声及对他的追忆，我懂得了谦虚和果敢。

sentences.english: Fight for the ancient sanctuary and Olympus, my fellow braves.
sentences.chinese: 为抢救上古神殿和奥林匹斯的运道而战吧，果敢的人。

sentences.english: A day later, the Myanmar government army deployed hundreds of troops in Kokang.
sentences.chinese: 一天后，缅甸政府在果敢地区布军数百名。

sentences.english: Maureen Duffy reminded us of the audacity and courage of Aphra Behn in this regard.
sentences.chinese: 就这一问题，达菲提到了勇敢果敢的埃弗拉本。

sentences.english: Stockard, he shouted. You are a brave man.
sentences.chinese: “斯多卡德”他喊到，“你是一个果敢的人。

sentences.english: The situation spiralled when government troops then tried to raid the Kokang leader's home.
sentences.chinese: 当政府军队试图突袭果敢领导人家时，局势变得糟糕。

definition: to stop at nothing (idiom)/to dare to do anything
variant of 敢做敢當|敢做敢当[gan3 zuo4 gan3 dang1]
